titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the James Olinkiewicz Collection of Photographs and Ephemera
1850s-1910, 1932
PR 404
titlestmt.author: Joseph Ditta

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 15:48:57 -0400.

did.unittitle: James Olinkiewicz collection of photographs and ephemera
did.abstract: 673 stereograph cards of New York City (i.e., Manhattan) landmarks (1850s-circa 1900); one box of photographs and ephemera documenting the activities of the Kit Kat Club, an association of New York City-based artists (1888-1908, 1932); and a scrapbook of theater and recital programs, tickets, and photographs of Boston and some New York productions attended by one Mary E. Thayer (1904-1908, 1910).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized in three series:

defitem.label: Series I.
defitem.item: Stereographs of New York City and Elsewhere, 1850s-circa 1900

defitem.label: Series II.
defitem.item: Kit Kat Club Photographs and Ephemera, 1888-1908, 1932

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Open to qualified researchers by appointment only.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to reproduce any Department of Prints, Photographs and Architectural Collections holdings through publication must be obtained from: Rights and Reproductions, The New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, New York, NY 10024. Phone: (212) 873-3400 ext. 270. Fax: (212) 579-8794.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of James Olinkiewicz, 2018 (accession no. PPAC-2018-037).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The collection should be cited as the James Olinkiewicz Collection of Photographs and Ephemera, PR 404, Department of Prints, Photographs, and Architectural Collections, The New-York Historical Society.
Credit line for exhibitions: James Olinkiewicz.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Archivist Joseph Ditta arranged and described this collection in September 2019.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: A number of the stereographs in the Olinkiewicz Collection are duplicated in the New-York Historical Society's extensive Stereograph File, PR-65, which contains upwards of 17,000 views.

Mr. Olinkiewicz has also donated to the New-York Historical Society a complete set of Brooklyn Daily Eagle postcards (PR 355), and a photographic art album for the Steamship Idlewild (PR 2, vol. 478).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection combines three unrelated parts received together from the same donor:

673 stereograph cards with mid- to late-19th century views of New York City (i.e., Manhattan) landmarks such as the Brooklyn Bridge, Trinity Church, Central Park, Broadway, and the Tombs prison. Brooklyn and Staten Island are represented by a few cards, as are various locations throughout New York State, Pennsylvania, and Vermont.

Photographs, bylaws, printed programs, and invitations documenting the activities of the Kit Kat Club, a New York City-based association of artists organized in 1881 and incorporated in 1884. The club counted among its members such notables as lithographer Napoleon Sarony (1821-1896) and Impressionist painter William Merritt Chase (1841-1916). The Kit Kats sponsored annual summer sketching and painting excursions, three of which are represented by photographs and ephemera here: a week-long trip by barge on the Delaware and Hudson Canal (1895); a camping trip to Pelham Bay on Long Island Sound (1896); and a sail by schooner to Stony Brook, Long Island (1897). This material was assembled by William C. Ostrander, onetime president of the Kit Kat Club, and includes some items from the Salmagundi Club and the Black and White Club, other arts organizations which counted Ostrander as a member.

A scrapbook of programs, playbills, ticket stubs, and photographs from theatrical productions and musical recitals attended by one Mary E. Thayer, mostly in Boston with a few in New York, between October 1904 and September 1908. Thayer notes in the margin who attended each performance, e.g. "Norma & I," "Bert, Blanche & I," etc.

did.unittitle: Series I. Stereographs of New York City and Elsewhere

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 673 stereograph cards with mid- to late-19th century views of New York City (i.e., Manhattan) landmarks such as the Brooklyn Bridge, Trinity Church, Central Park, Broadway, and the Tombs prison. Brooklyn and Staten Island are represented by a few cards, as are various locations throughout New York State, Pennsylvania, and Vermont.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is organized in four sub-series, each of which is arranged by image topic:

defitem.label: Sub-series I.A.
defitem.item: New York City—Bridges, Harbor, Shipping, Rivers

did.unittitle: Sub-series I.A. New York City—Bridges, Harbor, Shipping, Rivers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Bank for Saving (Bleecker near Broadway); German Savings Bank (14th Street corner Fourth Avenue); Park Bank Building.

did.unittitle: Manhattan—Churches & Synagogues—Asbury Methodist Episcopal Church [1 card]
Manhattan—Churches & Synagogues—Church of the Covenant [1 card]
Manhattan—Churches & Synagogues—Church of the Holy Trinity [1 card]
Manhattan—Churches & Synagogues—St. Mark's Church in-the-Bowery [2 cards]
Manhattan—Clinton Hall (a.k.a. Astor Opera House) [2 cards]
Manhattan—Five Points House of Industry [3 cards]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Albermarle House; Astor House; Harry Bertholf's Hotel on Harlem Lane; Hotel Brunswick; Fifth Avenue Hotel; Grand Hotel; Grand Central Hotel (later Broadway Central Hotel); Lafarge House; St. Nicholas Hotel; Windsor Hotel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Evening Post; Herald (Park Row and Herald Square); Staats Zeitung; Tribune; World.

did.unittitle: Manhattan—Parks & Squares—Central Park—Cave & Ice Spring [4 cards]
Manhattan—Parks & Squares—Central Park—Mt. St. Vincent [1 card]
Manhattan—Schools & colleges—Cooper Institute / Cooper Union [3 cards]
Manhattan—Schools & colleges—National Academy of Design [4 cards]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: "Peddling ties on the Bowery"; "A New York Street Organ"; "Scene in New York"; "Scene in N.Y. Slums"; "Boot Blacks"; "Try Your Weight."

did.unittitle: Manhattan—Streets—Broadway—"burst of sunlight after a shower" [1 card]
Sub-series I.C. New York City—Brooklyn & Staten Island

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Elm Place Congregational Church; Plymouth Church.

did.unittitle: Sub-series I.D. New York State, Pennsylvania, Vermont
Series II. Kit Kat Club Photographs and Ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Photographs, bylaws, printed programs, and invitations documenting the activities of the Kit Kat Club, a New York City-based association of artists organized in 1881 and incorporated in 1884. The club counted among its members such notables as lithographer Napoleon Sarony (1821-1896) and Impressionist painter William Merritt Chase (1841-1916). The Kit Kats sponsored annual summer sketching and painting excursions, three of which are represented by photographs and ephemera here: a week-long trip by barge on the Delaware and Hudson Canal (1895); a camping trip to Pelham Bay Park in the Bronx (1896); and a sail by schooner to Stony Brook, Long Island (1897). This material was assembled by William C. Ostrander, onetime president of the Kit Kat Club, and includes some items from the Salmagundi Club and the Black and White Club, other arts organizations which counted Ostrander as a member.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The material in Series II was originally pasted or laid in a scrapbook, but had been removed and possibly reordered before it came to the New-York Historical Society. The archivist has left the photographs in the order in which they arrived, but has grouped the loose ephemera chronologically.

did.unittitle: Nan Kee letter to William C. Ostrander & family
Series III. Mary E. Thayer Scrapbook

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook of programs, playbills, ticket stubs, and photographs from theatrical productions and musical recitals attended by one Mary E. Thayer, mostly in Boston with a few in New York, between October 1904 and November 1908. Thayer notes in the margin who attended each performance, e.g. "Norma & I," "Bert, Blanche & I," etc.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The scrapbook runs chronologically, from October 1904 through November 1908, then skips to April 1910, where it ends.
